subSections.title: Descendants
Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かね}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かね}}. May be ultimately derived from [[onomatopoeia]] {{m|ja|カンカン|tr=kankan||clang clang}}, the sound of hitting metal. Compare Cantonese {{m|yue|金|tr=gam<sup>1</sup>||metal, gold}}, Sanskrit {{m|sa|कनक||gold, golden}}, possibly suggesting a common onomatopoeic derivation.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
* In former times, silver was the basis for the Japanese economy.
* In modern Japanese, ''kane'' is more commonly spelled using the character for {{m|en|gold}}: {{l|ja|金}}.
* The {{m|en|money}} sense is more commonly prefixed with {{m|ja|お|tr=o-}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|しろがね|r=y}}
Compound of {{compound|ja|sort=しろがね|白|tr1=shiro|t1=white|金|tr2=kane|t2=metal}}. Starting from the [[w:Muromachi period|Muromachi Period]], the ''kane'' changes to ''gane'' due to {{rendaku|しろがね}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|しろがね}}

# [[silver]]
# silver [[dust]] mixed into [[glue]] or some other [[base]]: silver [[paint]] or [[lacquer]]
# silver [[thread]]
# silver [[coin]]
# the [[color]] silver

subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text:
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|銀%色|しろがね%-いろ}}: a [[bright]] [[shining]] color, like [[silver]]
* {{ja-r|白%銀%蜘蛛|しろ%がね%-ぐも|rom=-}}, {{ja-r|銀%蜘蛛|しろがね%-ぐも}}: a type of [[spider]]
* {{ja-r|銀%細%工|しろがね-%ざ%いく}}: [[finework]] using silver
* {{ja-r|銀%師|しろがね%し}}: a [[silverworker]], a [[silversmith]]
* {{ja-r|銀%草|しろがね%そう}}: alternate term for {{taxlink|Dichocarpum stoloniferum|species|ver=171201}}, a type of low-growing flowering plant in family [[Ranunculaceae]]
* {{ja-r|銀%作|しろがね%-づくり}}: something [[decorated]] in silver, or made from silver
* {{ja-r|銀%屋|しろがね%や}}: a [[silverworker]] or [[silversmith]]'s place of business; a [[silverworker]] or [[silversmith]]; {{qualifier|archaic}} a [[moneychanger]]
{{der-bottom}}
